title: Task Force on the United States Postal System

enrichment.summary: This executive order creates a task force to review the financial challenges facing the United States Postal Service (USPS) and to develop recommendations for improving its operations and sustainability. The task force, led by the Secretary of the Treasury, will evaluate USPS's business model, finances, and role in the economy and submit a report with reform proposals within 120 days.
potential_concerns: Recommendations to restructure USPS may lead to job losses or reduced benefits for postal workers, impacting their retirement security and employment conditions.
Reducing or altering the universal service obligation could negatively affect rural communities that rely heavily on USPS for mail and package delivery.
Seniors and elderly populations may face diminished access to timely, reliable mail services critical for receipt of medications, bills, and communications.
Small business owners depending on affordable and consistent USPS delivery services might encounter increased costs or service disruptions due to proposed reforms.
